sen.j: 顕如の時代、本願寺教団は、父の時代以来進めてきた門徒による一向一揆の掌握に務める一方、管領の細川家や京の公家との縁戚関係を深めた。
sen.e: During the era of Ken'nyo, while the Hongan-ji Temple sect tried to take control of Ikko uprisings by their followers which had been in progress since his father's era, he cultivated alliances with relatives of the shogunal deputy, the Hosokawa family or Kyo's Kuge, court nobles.

sen.j: 経済的・軍事的な要衝である石山本願寺を拠点として、主に畿内を中心に本願寺派の寺を配置し、大名に匹敵する権力を有するようになり、教団は最盛期を迎えていた。
sen.e: Based on Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple which was an economic and martially strategic point, they placed Hongan-ji sect temples mainly in Kinai, gained power matched to Daimyos, and attained the peak period of the sect.

Based at the economically and strategically important Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, they built Hongan-ji sect temples mainly in and around Kyoto and acquired power to match the Daimyos, in what was the sect's heyday.

Based at the economically and strategically important Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, they built Hongan-ji school temples mainly in and around Kyoto and acquired power to match the Daimyos (Japanese territorial lords), in what was the sect's heyday.

sen.e: However, since Hongan-ji Temple held these powers outside of the feudal system, Nobunaga ODA (who entered Kyoto in 1568 and was trying to gain control over Kinai), started to oppress them as well as Enryaku-ji Temple, or Machi-shu, an elite group of businessmen and artisans, of Sakai-city.

sen.j: しかし、長期にわたる攻囲戦によって次第に疲弊する一方、縁戚関係にあった信玄の支援を期待していたが、信玄の急死が大きな痛手となり、さらに朝倉、浅井などの同盟勢力が次々と織田氏によって滅ぼされたため抗戦継続の困難を悟り朝廷に和平の仲介役を依頼した。
sen.e: However, while his group suffered a war of attrition through the prolonged siege, Ken'nyo was hard hit by the sudden death of his relative Shingen, from whom he had been hoping for assistance. Furthermore, the alliance powers, such as Asakura and Azai, were destroyed by the Oda family one after another. He came to realise the hardship of continuous war and asked court to be an intermediary for peace.

sen.j: しかし、翌文禄元年（1592年）に顕如が没すると、石山本願寺退去時の信長への対応をめぐって顕如と意見の食い違いがあった長男の教如（強硬派）に代わり、三男の准如（和睦派）が12世門主に立てられることになった（次男は興正寺顕尊）。
sen.e: However, when Ken'nyo died the next year, 1592, instead of his eldest son, Kyonyo (a Hard-liner), who had different opinions from Ken'nyo at the time of leaving Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple), the third son, Jun'nyo (an accommodationist) succeeded as 12th Chief of the sect. (The second son is Koshoji-temple Kenson.)

However, when Ken'nyo died the following year, it was his third son, Jun'nyo (an accommodationist) not his eldest son, Kyonyo, a hard-liner who held different opinions from Ken'nyo regarding Nobunaga at the time of leaving Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, who became the 12th head priest. (The second son was Kenson of Koshoji-temple.)

However, when Kennyo died the following year, it was his third son, Junnyo (an accommodationist) not his eldest son, Kyonyo, a hard-liner who held different opinions from Kennyo regarding Nobunaga at the time of leaving Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple, who became the twelfth head priest. (The second son was Kenson of Kosho-ji Temple.)
